main event: A gold globe, the size of a basketball, was observed moving from northwest to southeast over Killeen, Texas, on September 1, 1958, by military personnel. The object had a steady flight path and gradually disappeared to the southeast.
interesting points: The observation lasted 15 seconds, indicating rapid flight.
There were conflicting details, such as the gold color of the globe conflicting with analysis.
The report was made by military personnel, adding credibility to the sighting.
The observer was identified as MSGT Craig S Hopkins, a member of the 366th Army Band, with good credentials.
The sighting occurred at 22:55Z on September 5, 1958, under clear weather conditions.
